comments:
Cellular Biology and Biochemistry is an introduction to both cellular and protein structures and functions. Specific topics covered include: enzyme kinetics; mechanisms of enzyme action and allosteric regulation of enzyme activity; membrane structure, membrane receptors and signal transduction; motility; and the cell cycle.

Students gave mixed reviews about the course content. One student stated that the “material genuinely stimulates [his] desire to learn,” while another student complained about repetition, commenting, “This class is essentially the same as Biology 121.” Many students commented on the breadth of the topics covered.

Students liked Professor Cashmore’s teaching style. One student described him as a “dynamic speaker.” However, students felt that the tag teaching method could have been more streamlined, as the teaching styles of the two professors were very different.

Many students recommended taking the BIOL 101 and BIOL 102 track instead of the BIOL121 and BIOL 202 track.

Cellular Biology and Biochemistry is an introduction to both cellular and protein structures and functions. Specific topics covered include: enzyme kinetics; mechanisms of enzyme action and allosteric regulation of enzyme activity; membrane structure, membrane receptors and signal transduction; motility; and the cell cycle.

Students gave mixed reviews about the course content. One student stated that the “material genuinely stimulates [his] desire to learn,” while another student complained about repetition, commenting, “This class is essentially the same as Biology 121.” Many students commented on the breadth of the topics covered.

Students also had mixed feelings about Professor Guo’s communication abilities. Though they appreciated his enthusiasm for the subject, some students wrote that they had trouble understanding him, though this was not the opinion of everyone who reviewed the course.

Students felt that the tag teaching method could have been more streamlined, as the teaching styles of the two professors were very different. Many recommended taking the BIOL 101 and BIOL 102 track instead of the BIOL121 and BIOL 202 track.
